description.narrative:
Mercy Corps proposes this two year project as follow?on to the TANGGUH project implemented from April 2012 to June 2013 in Bojonegoro District in Eastern Java in partnership with ExxonMobil and Mobil Cepu Limited (MCL). The previous project targeted youth in six villages in the area surrounding the Exxon exploration area. The project engaged 150 youth in a variety of youth development activities, including life skills training, workforce skills building and enterprise development support. This follow?on project intends to build on the previous TANGGUH project by expanding to 10 additional communities in the same region. The new project will adjust programmatic approaches and activities based on lessons learned during the previous phase, while also incorporating suggestions from the MCL team and aiming to complement programs undertaken by MCL’s other partners in the same region.
TANGGUH II will take into account the changed circumstances related to the ExxonMobil/MCL operations in the region. The critical factor is that most of the current unskilled labor force of MCL in Bojonegoro will gradually be laid off in the course of 2014, when the current construction phase comes to an end. As a result, an estimated 6000 employees will find themselves out of work and potentially disillusioned and worried about their future. TANGGUH II will seek to offer youth in the region opportunities and examples of economic enterprise and social engagement to counter the negative impact on youth’s moral and future prospects caused by these layoffs. Furthermore, the project will encourage and train MCL workers to manage their finances wisely while still employed in order to better plan for the times when their employment ends.

The goal of the project is to improve prospects for youth to engage in economically productive activities and participate in civic life in their community.
The project purpose is to increase the capacity of Bojonegoro youth to be economically productive and serve as civic leaders and agents of positive change
The specific objectives are: 1. To enhance youth’s basic financial planning and management skills. 2. To promote youth entrepreneurship through capacity building and enterprise development support. 3. To promote youth’s civic engagement in their communities.
